007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a tetrahedron as a
016   triangular pyramid with an equilateral triangle
017   base (centered at the origin in the xz-plane)
018   whose three vertices are connected to a 4th vertex
019   on the positive y-axis.
020
021   @see Tetrahedron
022*/
023public class TriangularPyramid extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
024{
025   public final double r;
026   public final double h;
027   public final int n;
028   public final int k;
029   public final MeshType type;
030
031   /**
032      Create a regular tetrahedron having side length
033      {@code sqrt(3)/sqrt(2)}, with one face in the
034      xz-plane with its center at the origin, and the
035      4th vertex on the positive y-axis at height 1.
036   */
037   public TriangularPyramid( )
038   {
039      this(Math.sqrt(3)/Math.sqrt(2)); // makes the height = 1
040      //or
041      //this(Math.sqrt(3));  // make the height = sqrt(2) > 1
042   }
043
044
045   /**
046      Create a regular tetrahedron having side length {@code s},
047      with one face in the xz-plane with its center at the origin,
048      and with the 4th vertex on the positive y-axis at
049      height {@code s*sqrt(2)/sqrt(3)}.
050
051      @param s  the length of the regular tetrahedron's sides
052   */
053   public TriangularPyramid(final double s)
054   {
055      this(s/Math.sqrt(3), s*Math.sqrt(2)/Math.sqrt(3));
056   }
057
058
059   /**
060      Create a tetrahedron with one face being an equilateral triangle
061      inscribed in a circle of radius {@code r} centered at the origin
062      of the xz-plane and with the 4th vertex on the y-axis at height
063      {@code h}.
064   <p>
065      If {@code h = r * sqrt(2)}, then the tetrahedron is a regular tetrahedron.
066      with side length {@code s = r * sqrt(3)}.
067   <p>
068      Another way to state this is, if an equilateral triangle is inscribed
069      in a circle of radius {@code r}, then the edge length of the triangle
070      is {@code r*sqrt(3)} and the height of the regular tetrahedron made
071      from the triangle is {@code r*sqrt(2)}.
072
073      @param r  radius of circle in xz-plane that the equilateral base is inscribed in
074      @param h  coordinate on the y-axis of the apex
075   */
076   public TriangularPyramid(final double r, final double h)
077   {
078      super(String.format("Triangular Pyramid(%.2f,%.2f)", r, h));
079
080      this.r = r;
081      this.h = h;
082      this.n = 1;
083      this.k = 1;
084      this.type = MeshType.HORIZONTAL;
085
086      // Create the tetrahedron's geometry.
087      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0);
088      addVertex(new Vertex( r,   0,    0),  // three vertices around the bottom face
089                new Vertex(-r/2, 0,  r*0.5*sqrt3),
090                new Vertex(-r/2, 0, -r*0.5*sqrt3),
091                new Vertex( 0,   h,    0)); // vertex at the top
092
093      // Create 4 triangles.
094      //  https://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/34959/triangle-strips-of-tetraheron
095      //  https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Tutorial4:_Using_Indices_and_Geometry_Shaders_(C_/SDL)
096      //  https://cs.lmu.edu/~ray/notes/openglexamples/
097      addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 2),   // bottom face
098                   new TriangleFan(3, 0, 2, 1, 0));
099   }
100
101
102   /**
103      Create a tetrahedron with one face being an equilateral triangle
104      inscribed in a circle of radius {@code r} centered at the origin
105      of the xz-plane and with the 4th vertex on the y-axis at height
106      {@code h}.
107   <p>
108      If {@code h = r * sqrt(2)}, then the tetrahedron is a regular tetrahedron.
109      with side length {@code s = r * sqrt(3)}.
110   <p>
111      Another way to state this is, if an equilateral triangle is inscribed
112      in a circle of radius {@code r}, then the edge length of the triangle
113      is {@code r*sqrt(3)} and the height of the regular tetrahedron made
114      from the triangle is {@code r*sqrt(2)}.
115
116      @param r  radius of circle in xz-plane that the equilateral base is inscribed in
117      @param h  coordinate on the y-axis of the apex
118      @param n  number of lines of latitude around the body of the pyramid
119      @param k  number of triangles in the triangle fan at the top of each side
120      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 1
121      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
122   */
123   public TriangularPyramid(final double r, final double h,
124                            final int n, final int k)
125   {
126      this(r, h, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
127   }
128
129
130   /**
131      Create a tetrahedron with one face being an equilateral triangle
132      inscribed in a circle of radius {@code r} centered at the origin
133      of the xz-plane and with the 4th vertex on the y-axis at height
134      {@code h}.
135   <p>
136      If {@code h = r * sqrt(2)}, then the tetrahedron is a regular tetrahedron.
137      with side length {@code s = r * sqrt(3)}.
138   <p>
139      Another way to state this is, if an equilateral triangle is inscribed
140      in a circle of radius {@code r}, then the edge length of the triangle
141      is {@code r*sqrt(3)} and the height of the regular tetrahedron made
142      from the triangle is {@code r*sqrt(2)}.
143
144      @param r  radius of circle in xz-plane that the equilateral base is inscribed in
145      @param h  coordinate on the y-axis of the apex
146      @param n  number of lines of latitude around the body of the pyramid
147      @param k  number of triangles in the triangle fan at the top of each side
148      @param type  choose between striped and checkerboard triangle strips
149      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 1
150      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 1
151   */
152   public TriangularPyramid(final double r, final double h,
153                            final int n, final int k,
154                            final MeshType type)
155   {
156      super(String.format("Triangular Pyramid(%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
157                                              r,   h,   n, k));
158
159      if (n < 1)
160         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 0");
161      if (k < 1)
162         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 0");
163
164      this.r = r;
165      this.h = h;
166      this.n = n;
167      this.k = k;
168      this.type = type;
169
170      // Create the pyramid's geometry.
171      // An array of vertices to be used to create faces.
172      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][3*k];
173
174      // Create the vertices.
175      final Vertex apex = new Vertex(0, h, 0);
176      final Vertex centerVertex = new Vertex(0, 0, 0);
177
178      // three vertices around the bottom face
179      final double sqrt3 = Math.sqrt(3.0);
180      Vertex v0 = new Vertex( r,   0,    0);
181      Vertex v1 = new Vertex(-r/2, 0,  r*0.5*sqrt3);
182      Vertex v2 = new Vertex(-r/2, 0, -r*0.5*sqrt3);
183
184      for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) // choose a height of latitude
185      {
186         final double y = i * (h / n);
187
188         // Use linear interpolation (lerp).
189         final double t = i * (1.0 / n);
190         final Vertex vA = new Vertex( (1-t)*v0.x + t*apex.x,
191                                                           y,
192                                       (1-t)*v0.z + t*apex.z );
193         final Vertex vB = new Vertex( (1-t)*v1.x + t*apex.x,
194                                                           y,
195                                       (1-t)*v1.z + t*apex.z );
196         final Vertex vC = new Vertex( (1-t)*v2.x + t*apex.x,
197                                                           y,
198                                       (1-t)*v2.z + t*apex.z );
199
200         // use linear interpolation again
201         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
202         {
203            final double s = j * (1.0 / k);
204            v[i][j] = new Vertex( (1-s)*vA.x + s*vB.x,
205                                                    y,
206                                  (1-s)*vA.z + s*vB.z );
207
208            v[i][k+j] = new Vertex( (1-s)*vB.x + s*vC.x,
209                                                      y,
210                                    (1-s)*vB.z + s*vC.z );
211
212            v[i][2*k+j] = new Vertex( (1-s)*vC.x + s*vA.x,
213                                                        y,
214                                      (1-s)*vC.z + s*vA.z );
215         }
216      }
217
218      // Add the vertices to this model.
219      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
220      {
221         for (int j = 0; j < 3*k; ++j)
222         {
223            addVertex( v[i][j] );
224         }
225      }
226      addVertex(apex,
227                centerVertex);
228      final int apexIndex = n * 3*k,
229                centerIndex = apexIndex + 1;
230
231      // Create all the square strips around the pyramid wall.
232      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
233      {
234         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
235         {
236            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
237            for (int j = 0; j < 3*k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
238            {
239               triStrip.addIndex(     i*(3*k)+j ); // v[i  ][j]
240               triStrip.addIndex( (1+i)*(3*k)+j ); // v[i+1][j]
241            }
242            triStrip.addIndex(     i*(3*k)+0 ); // v[i  ][0]
243            triStrip.addIndex( (1+i)*(3*k)+0 ); // v[i+1][0]
244            addPrimitive(triStrip);
245         }
246      }
247      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
248      {
249         for (int j = 0; j < 3*k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
250         {
251            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
252            triStrip.addIndex(centerIndex);
253            for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
254            {
255               triStrip.addIndex(i * (3*k) + j);    // v[i][j  ]
256               triStrip.addIndex(i * (3*k) + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
257            }
258            triStrip.addIndex(apexIndex);
259            addPrimitive(triStrip);
260         }
261         // Last vertical strip to close the pyramid.
262         final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
263         triStrip.addIndex(centerIndex);
264         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
265         {
266            triStrip.addIndex(i * (3*k) + 3*k-1);  // v[i][3k-1 ]
267            triStrip.addIndex(i * (3*k) + 0);      // v[i][0    ]
268         }
269         triStrip.addIndex(apexIndex);
270         addPrimitive(triStrip);
271      }
272      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
273      {
274         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a height of latitude
275         {
276            for (int j = 0; j < 3*k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
277            {
278               addPrimitive(
279                  new TriangleStrip(    i*(3*k)+j,      // v[i  ][j  ]
280                                    (1+i)*(3*k)+j,      // v[i+1][j  ]
281                                        i*(3*k)+j+1,    // v[i  ][j+1]
282                                    (1+i)*(3*k)+j+1 )); // v[i+1][j+1]
283            }
284            addPrimitive(
285               new TriangleStrip(    i*(3*k)+3*k-1,  // v[i  ][3k-1]
286                                 (1+i)*(3*k)+3*k-1,  // v[i+1][3k-1]
287                                     i*(3*k)+0     , // v[i  ][0]
288                                 (1+i)*(3*k)+0 ));   // v[i+1][0]
289         }
290      }
291
292
293      if ( MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type
294        || MeshType.CHECKER == type )
295      {
296         // Create the triangle fan at the apex.
297         final Primitive apexFan = new TriangleFan();
298         apexFan.addIndex(apexIndex);
299         for (int j = 3*k - 1; j >= 0; --j) // choose a line of longitude
300         {
301            apexFan.addIndex( (n-1)*(3*k)+j );   // v[n-1][j]
302         }
303         apexFan.addIndex( (n-1)*(3*k)+3*k-1 );  // v[n-1][3k-1]
304         addPrimitive(apexFan);
305
306         // Create the triangle fan in the base.
307         final Primitive baseFan = new TriangleFan();
308         baseFan.addIndex(centerIndex);
309         for (int j = 0; j < 3*k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
310         {
311            baseFan.addIndex( j ); // v[0][j]
312         }
313         baseFan.addIndex( 0 );    // v[0][0]
314         addPrimitive(baseFan);
315      }
316   }
317
318
319
320   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
321   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
322
323   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
324
325   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
326
327   @Override
328   public TriangularPyramid remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
329   {
330      return new TriangularPyramid(this.r, this.h,
331                                   n, k,
332                                   type);
333   }
334}//TriangularPyramid
